message: The STAT_CONC_DEF field for indicator 16-2-1, translated into en
data:
Physical punishment is an act that causes physical pain and discomfort but not to the extent of causing injury.

Mental punishment is the act of shouting, scolding, etc., which is insulting and insulting to children.

Percentage of people under the age of 18 who have been physically or mentally punished by their caregivers or caregivers in the past month is the percentage of people under the age of 18 who have experienced any kind of abuse. physical or mental punishment by carers in the past month compared to the total number of people under the age of 18 surveyed.
